page.head: Prenatal Care
page.body: "My baby teeth won't all be in place until i'm about 3 years old" "My permanent teeth begin developing at or after birth." By the time the baby teeth are all visible, the permanent teeth are developing. Permanent teeth lay hidden under the gums, occupying most of the upper and lower jaw area. Once the crown of a tooth is in the mouth, it does not grow larger.

page.head: Did you know?
page.body: “My teeth start to form 7 weeks after you become pregnant.” Baby teeth are almost fully developed beneath the gums at birth.

page.head: Did you know?
page.body: – Incisors (front teeth) begin to develop at 7 weeks into pregnancy and calcify (harden with enamel) at about 15 weeks. – The First Molars begin to develop at 8 weeks and calcify at about 16 weeks. – The Cuspids (eye teeth) begin to develop at 7 ½ weeks and calcify at about 17 weeks. – The Second Molars begin to develop at 10 weeks and calcify at about 19 weeks.
